alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:09PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pottawatomie County through 345 PM CDT... At 309 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Shawnee to 4 miles northwest of Tecumseh to near Pink. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shawnee, Tecumseh, Pink, Earlsboro, Johnson and Bethel Acres. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 177 and 194. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
